PT J
AU Sabok, M
   Zapletal, J
AF Sabok, Marcin
   Zapletal, Jindrich
TI FORCING PROPERTIES OF IDEALS OF CLOSED SETS
SO JOURNAL OF SYMBOLIC LOGIC
LA English
DT Article
DE forcing; ideals; Katetov order
AB With every sigma-ideal I on a Polish space we associate the sigma-ideal I* generated by the closed sets in I. We study the forcing notions of Borel sets modulo the respective sigma-ideals I and I* and find connections between their forcing properties. To this end, we associate to a sigma-ideal on a Polish space an ideal on a countable set and show how forcing properties of the forcing depend on combinatorial properties of the ideal.
   We also study the I-I or constant property of sigma-ideals. i.e., the property that every Borel function defined on a Borel positive set can be restricted to a positive Borel set on which it either 1-1 or constant. We prove the following dichotomy: if I is a sigma-ideal generated by closed sets, then either the forcing P(I) adds a Cohen real, or else I has the 1-1 or constant property.
C1 [Sabok, Marcin] Uniwersytetu Wrociawskiego, Inst Matemat, PL-50384 Wroclaw, Poland.
   [Sabok, Marcin] Polskiej Akad Nauk, Inst Matemat, PL-00956 Warsaw, Poland.
   [Zapletal, Jindrich] Acad Sci Czech Republic, Inst Math, CZ-11567 Prague 11567, Czech Republic.
   [Zapletal, Jindrich] Univ Florida, Dept Math, Gainesville, FL 32611 USA.

PT J
AU Mamino, M
AF Mamino, Marcello
TI SPLITTING DEFINABLY COMPACT GROUPS IN O-MINIMAL STRUCTURES
SO JOURNAL OF SYMBOLIC LOGIC
LA English
DT Article
DE Definable groups; o-minimality; fibre bundles
ID HOMOTOPY
AB An argument of A. Borel [Bor-61, Proposition 3.1] shows that every compact connected Lie group is homeomorphic to the Cartesian product of its derived subgroup and a torus. We prove a parallel result for definably compact definably connected groups definable in an o-minimal expansion of a real closed field, As opposed to the Lie case, however, we provide an example showing that the derived subgroup may not have a definable semidirect complement.
C1 Classe Sci Scuola Normale Super, I-56126 Pisa, Italy.

PT J
AU Berenstein, A
   Dolich, A
   Onshuus, A
AF Berenstein, Alexander
   Dolich, Alf
   Onshuus, Alf
TI THE INDEPENDENCE PROPERTY IN GENERALIZED DENSE PAIRS OF STRUCTURES
SO JOURNAL OF SYMBOLIC LOGIC
LA English
DT Article
DE Rosy theories; lovely pairs; dense pairs; dependent theories; strongly
   dependent theories
ID O-MINIMAL STRUCTURES; SETS
AB We provide a general theorem implying that for a (strongly) dependent theory T the theory of sufficiently well-behaved pairs of models of T is again (strongly) dependent. We apply the theorem to the case of lovely pairs of thorn-rank one theories as well as to a setting of dense pairs of first-order topological theories.

PT J
AU Matet, P
AF Matet, Pierre
TI THE MAGIDOR FUNCTION AND DIAMOND
SO JOURNAL OF SYMBOLIC LOGIC
LA English
DT Article
DE P(kappa)(lambda); diamond principle
ID STATIONARY SETS; MODEL
AB Let kappa be a regular uncountable cardinal and lambda be a cardinal greater than kappa. We show that if 2(<kappa) <= M (kappa, lambda), then (Sic)(kappa,lambda) holds, where M (kappa, lambda) equals lambda(N0) if cf (lambda) >= kappa, and (lambda(+))(N0) otherwise.
C1 Univ Caen, CNRS, Math Lab, F-14032 Caen, France.
RP Matet, P (reprint author), Univ Caen, CNRS, Math Lab, BP 5186, F-14032 Caen, France.
EM matet@math.unicaen.fr

PT J
AU Welch, PD
AF Welch, P. D.
TI WEAK SYSTEMS OF DETERMINACY AND ARITHMETICAL QUASI-INDUCTIVE DEFINITIONS
SO JOURNAL OF SYMBOLIC LOGIC
LA English
DT Article
ID ORDINAL ANALYSIS
AB We locate winning strategies for various Sigma(0)(3)-games in the L-hierarchy in order to prove the following:
   THEOREM 1. KP + Sigma(2)-Comprehension proves there exists alpha L(alpha) satisfies "Sigma(2)-KP +Sigma(0)(3)-Determinacy."
   Alternatively: Pi(1)(3)-CA(0) proves "there is a beta-model of Delta(1)(3)-CA(0) + E(3)(0)-Determinacy." The implication is not reversible. (The antecedent here may be replaced with Pi(1)(3)(Pi(1)(3))-CA(0): Pi(1)(3) instances of Comprehension with only Pi(1)(3)-lightface definable parameters-or even weaker theories.)
   THEOREM 2. KP + Delta(2)-Comprehension +Sigma(2)-Replacement + AQI does not prove Sigma(0)(3)-Determinacy.
   (Here AQI is the assertion that every arithmetical quasi-inductive definition converges.) Alternatively: Delta(1)(3)CA(0) + AQI does not prove Sigma(0)(3)-Determinacy.
   Hence the theories: Pi(1)(3)-CA(0), Delta(1)(3)-CA(0) + Sigma(0)(3)-Det, Delta(1-)(3)CA(0) + AQI, and Delta(1)(3)-CA(0) are in strictly descending order of strength.
C1 Univ Bristol, Sch Math, Bristol BS8 1TW, Avon, England.
RP Welch, PD (reprint author), Univ Bristol, Sch Math, Univ Walk, Bristol BS8 1TW, Avon, England.
EM p.welch@bristol.ac.uk
OI Welch, Philip/0000-0001-8350-1430
FU Templeton Foundation; EPSRC of the UK
FX The major part of this work was done in 2003. However the author would
   like to thank the Templeton Foundation and the EPSRC of the UK for
   grants contributing to the refining of this research, and the Kurt Godel
   Research Institute, Vienna, for its hospitality during that process and
   the writing of this paper. We should like to thank R. Lubarsky for his
   corrections and helpful suggestions to the later draft.
